thread.title: No. 2 Beetdiggers host No. 1 Miners with region title hopes on the line
thread.title_full: No. 2 Beetdiggers host No. 1 Miners with region title hopes on the line

title: No. 2 Beetdiggers host No. 1 Miners with region title hopes on the line
text:
No. 2 Beetdiggers host No. 1 Miners with region title hopes on the line By Rod Zundel | Posted Oct 14th, 2015 @ 6:53pm 0  
SANDY — At least a share of the Region 3 title is up for grabs when No. 2 Jordan hosts No. 1 Bingham on Wednesday at 7 p.m. during an early schedule of high school football due to UEA break. 
Jordan (7-1, 4-0 Region 3) comes into the game with one of the state's high-powered offenses, led by quarterback Drew Lisk, who has thrown for 2,737 yards and 24 touchdowns with six interceptions. 
Bingham (7-1, 4-0) provides the immovable defense, holding opponents to 7.25 points per game with five shutouts. The Miners have outscored opponents 278-58, which includes a 38-20 loss at Bishop Gorman (Las Vegas, Nevada) that was then ranked No. 1 in the nation by MaxPreps.com. 
Both teams, though, know the battle will be anything but easy, and the Miners' 33-game winning streak against in-state opponents will be put to the test. 
Click the video to see a preview of the game, and watch it live via the embedded video below or on live.ksl.com . Related Stories
